item.title: Conseiller en communication TI - 4 mois Stage/Coop (Été 2023)
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

C\'est plus qu\'une belle carrière. C\'est un bel avenir.

Tu es étudiant ou nouveau diplômé et souhaite acquérir une expérience inestimable et accélérer ta carrière? Chaque année, nous accueillons plus de 300 stagiaires à travers le pays ! Nos stages offrent une expérience de travail significative ainsi qu\'une formation unique. Non seulement tu bénéficieras d’une solide expérience, mais tu contribueras également à la mission de l\'équipe et rencontreras des gens formidables en cours de route.

Nous recherchons de futurs talents qui aimeraient grandir avec nous. Si tu penses que le stage en Communications TI est fait pour toi et que tu souhaites faire partie de la famille Intact, lis ce qui suit et envoie-nous ta candidature dès aujourd\'hui ! En plus, il s\'agit d\'un stage rémunéré !

Ce que tu ferais avec nous :

Relevant de la directrice des communications TI, le ou la stagiaire sera responsable de faire rayonner les équipes des technologies de l’information (TI) et celles des Labs et de les assister dans toutes leurs communications et tous leurs événements tant internes qu’externes.

Mandat :

  • Participation aux réunions hebdomadaires de l’équipe des coms TI et contribution sur les dossiers en cours
  • Proposition de sujets, recherche, rédaction et publication d’articles sur le SharePoint de l’équipe des TI et des Labs
  • Participation à l’organisation d’événements divers
  • Participation à la promotion de certaines équipes TI (Services TI et Sécurité de l’information) au sein d’Intact
  • Participation à la promotion de la marque employeur de l’équipe des TI et des Labs en interne et en externe

Qualifications

  • BAC en Communication ou Marketing ou Journalisme en cours ou finalisé
  • Expérience de stage préalable
  • Intérêt pour le marketing (atout)
  • Excellentes compétences de rédaction en français OU en anglais
  • Le bilinguisme (français et anglais) est considéré comme un atout car ce rôle nécessite d’interagir sur une base régulière avec des collègues partout au pays 
  • Autonomie et proactivité
  • Capacité de synthèse et de vulgarisation
  • Créativité
  • Grand sens de l’organisation et de la rigueur
  • Intérêt pour le monde des TI
  • Maîtrise de la suite Microsoft (incluant SharePoint) un atout
  • Disponible 35 heures par semaine du 8 mai au 25 août 2023

N’hésite pas à joindre un portfolio de tes réalisations (rédactions, etc.)

Ta carrière commence ici. Postule dès aujourd’hui!

Nous avons hâte d’apprendre à te connaître. N’oublie pas de joindre ton CV et ton relevé de notes universitaire à ton formulaire de candidature. Nous embauchons des stagiaires chaque session (hiver, été et automne)!

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact, belairdirect, or Johnson Insurance, please apply for this role on Contact People.

item.title: Designer UI - 4 mois Stage/Coop (Été 2023)
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Comme Stagiaire UI, vous jouerez un rôle crucial dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. 

 

Vos responsabilités 

  • Participer à l’évolution de notre Design System avec l’ajout d’éléments visuels pour les marques d’Intact Corporation Financière. 

  • Création d’icônes et d’illustrations suivant la direction artistique déjà établit 

  • Collaborations avec les designers UX et les développeurs 

Vous aurez aussi la chance 

  • de découvrir à quoi ressemble le travail de Designer et comment les avancées technologiques changent les façons de faire en assurance;  

  • d’explorer de nouvelles idées et d’apprendre les meilleures pratiques dans un environnement agréable et inclusif; 

  • de mettre à profit votre créativité pour aider l’équipe à régler des problèmes et de contribuer à des projets importants et stimulants; 

  • de participer à des activités sociales avec l’équipe pour rencontrer des gens et célébrer les réussites. 

 

Vos compétences 

  • Diplôme d\'études supérieures ou maîtrise en UI ou tous autres domaines connexes; 

  • Bonne connaissance de Figma et famille de produit Adobe CC 

  • Aptitudes créatives, participation aux sessions de brainstorm 

  • Au-delà de la créativité, être capable de se mettre en mode « production » afin de décliner des concepts créatifs. 

  • Avoir un esprit d’analyse et de résolution de problèmes;   

  • Avoir une autonomie et un bon sens des responsabilités; 

  • Être bilingue (Français & Anglais) car ce rôle nécessite d’interagir sur une base régulière avec des collègues partout au pays

item.title: UX Designer
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

About us

How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? We bet that if you swing by Intact Lab, you\'ll be in for quite the surprise! With offices in downtown Toronto and Montreal, the Lab is a digital innovation hub tasked with creating cutting-edge insurtech products that improve the lives of millions of Canadians.

The Lab merges the best of two worlds: the speed and culture of a start-up, with the resources and means of a large enterprise (you\'ll have access to all the tools you\'ve ever dreamed of!). With a dynamic team, exciting challenges, beautiful offices, inspiring colleagues and a great work culture (we rank as one of Canada\'s top 100 places to work), Intact Lab offers an amazing environment to develop your skills and grow your career.

About you

Are you passionate about digital innovation and Mobile experiences? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We\'ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

Your role

As a UX Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital experience. Reporting to the Manager Design, Mobile Apps, your main responsibilities are:

  • Crafting human-centered experiences that help achieve business objectives.
  • Giving a voice to our customers by leveraging user-centric design practices.
  • Translate user needs and business requirements into engaging mobile features and functionality.
  • Assess and optimize feature performance with customers, analytics, and design research.
  • Work across cross-functional teams to design customer experiences and internal processes.
  • Create all assets to effectively conceptualize, communicate, and deliver the user-experience.


Qualifications

  • At least 3 years of experience as a UX Designer or Lead UX Designer.
  • Strong capabilities in usability testing and user-centered design practices.
  • Capacity to understand business needs and to translate them into design requirements.
  • Mastery of design tools, especially Figma.
  • Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.).
  • Experience in producing customer journey maps, process flows, content inventories, etc.
  • You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.

Please include your portfolio in your application.

You are

  • Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious.
  • A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback.
  • You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders.
  • Deeply passionate about design and quality.
  • Organized, fully autonomous and proactive.

As a full-time employee your benefits include

  • A competitive salary.
  • An annual performance bonus.
  • A pension plan.
  • Flexible work hours and a 35 hour work week.
  • Top of the line medical and dental insurance.
  • A new MacBook Pro.
  • And many more benefits (gym refunds, paid conferences, etc.).

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

item.title: Annotateur (Temporaire - 6 mois)
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Qui a besoin d\'assurance? Tout le monde. Et ça nous tient occupés. Très occupés.

Chez Intact Lab, nous transformons l’expérience client de millions de Canadiens avec l’apprentissage machine, la science des données, le génie logiciel, l’IA, l’agilité, l’expérience utilisateur et la conception créative.

Simplifier l\'assurance demande empathie, créativité et détermination. On explore, on prend des risques, on se trompe, et on apprend, tout le temps.

Chez nous, l’innovation, c’est l’affaire de tous. Prêt à laisser votre marque?

Au Lab Intact, nous travaillons à entraîner des modèles d’apprentissage machine basés entre autres sur des approches d’apprentissage supervisé. Ce type d’approche requiert un grand nombre de données annotées que l’on utilise pour bâtir des jeux de données d’entraînement et de validation.

Afin de nous assurer que nos modèles sont aussi performants que nous le visons, l’Annotateur est responsable de repérer, d’étiqueter et de catégoriser le plus fidèlement possible un grand nombre de données provenant de jeux de données textes, audio et images tels que des transcriptions de conversations téléphoniques, des clavardages, des notes de réclamations, des photos de dommage sur des véhicules et bien d’autres.

En tant qu’Annotateur, votre excellent travail servira notamment aux scientifiques de données du Lab qui veulent évaluer des modèles d’apprentissage machine existants et entraîner de nouveaux modèles.

Relevant du gestionnaire d’une équipe affectée à la mise en place et à la structuration de certaines initiatives du Lab, vous travaillerez conjointement avec nos autres annotateurs et vous serez formé à utiliser des consignes précises afin de bien annoter les données au bénéfice de différentes équipes de l’Intact Lab – Science de données.

Responsabilités principales :

  • Annoter différents jeux de données à partir des consignes fournies.
  • Être une personne-ressource pour les questions touchant à l’annotation, à la linguistique ainsi qu’aux langues française et anglaise
  • Collaborer avec les équipes de l’Intact Lab – Science de Données dans la définition et le traitement de leurs besoins en annotation de données  

Capacités :

  • Faire preuve d’attention aux détails et de cohérence
  • Faire preuve de précision, d’un bon sens de l’observation et d’une grande rigueur
  • Rester concentré sur une longue période
  • Être dédié à la tâche
  • Savoir s’adapter au changement et faire face à l’ambiguïté
  • Avoir un esprit orienté vers la technologie
  • Avoir une excellente maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, parlés et écrits
  • Maîtriser les concepts de la linguistique appliquée
  • Avoir une excellente saisie au clavier
  • Faire preuve d’un grand professionnalisme: ponctualité, autonomie, etc.

Exigences

  • Formation académique (baccalauréat) en traduction, linguistique ou autre discipline langagière (atout)
  • Expérience en traduction, révision ou autres activités langagières (atout)

Voici quelques-uns des avantages qui amènent les gens à travailler chez nous :

  • Un milieu de travail inspirant et maintes fois primé qui soutient ses employés et reconnaît l’excellent travail accompli 
  • Des projets stimulants et ambitieux et des occasions de perfectionnement qui vous aideront à développer vos compétences et à faire progresser votre carrière.
  • La flexibilité de choisir où et comment vous travaillez.
  • Un régime complet d’avantages financiers qui reconnaît vos succès.
  • Une vaste gamme d’avantages sociaux flexibles.
  • Un régime d’achat d’actions des employés parmi les meilleurs de l’industrie, avec une cotisation de contrepartie correspondant à 50 % des actions nettes achetées.
  • Un code vestimentaire souple qui vous encourage à être vous-même.
  • Un compte de dépenses mieux-être prévoyant un montant annuel de base de 350 $ pour favoriser un mode de vie actif.

Égalité d’accès à l’emploi

Si nous pouvons rendre le processus de recrutement plus accessible pour vous, n’hésitez pas à nous dire quand nous pourrons vous faire part d’une possibilité d’emploi. Nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

Cliquer ici pour d’autres informations importantes sur le processus d’embauche, y compris la vérification des antécédents, les candidats internes et le droit de travailler au Canada.

#LI-IT #LI-Hybrid #IN-QC

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

item.title: Senior iOS and Android Developer for Rapid Prototyping
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We are looking for an experienced iOS and Android Developer for our new Rapid Prototyping team. This team\'s mission is to quickly assess the feasibility, desirability and viability of innovative features or technologies through the design, development, and implementation of functional prototypes. 

Responsibilities : 

As a Senior iOS and Android Developer, you will play an essential role in developing functional prototypes in a fast-paced environment. Reporting to the Manager of the Rapid Prototyping team, your main responsibilities will be: 

  • Conceive and build native mobile apps for iOS and Android 

  • Define and oversee application architecture 

  • Ensure performance, quality, and security of applications 

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team throughout product design and development 

  • When necessary, temporarily integrate the Intact mobile app development team and contribute to the achievement of its objectives 

  • Be on the lookout for new technologies; learn and apply new technologies and processes in real-world projects 

  • Participate in the ideation process for future projects 

  • Challenge the status quo 

You are : 

  • Autonomous, proactive, curious, and resourceful. You are a fast learner.  

  • Adaptable 

  • Motivated by challenges and an accelerated pace of work 

  • A team player who can share and receive constructive feedback 

  • An advocate for quality 

  • Able to work in French and English 

Ideal candidate : 

  • Experience in mobile software development 

  • Several native mobile applications launched 

  • Expertise with Swift and Kotlin languages 

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills 

This is a role in which you will be required to do programming with a rotating team. We are looking for someone who wants to work in an agile and changing environment and ensure the highest quality of deliverables.

item.title: Actuarial Analyst - 4 Month Co-op/Intern (Summer or Fall 2023)
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We are looking for future talent who would like to grow with us. If you think the Actuarial Analyst internship is for you and you\'re interested in becoming part of the Intact family, then please read the following and send us your application today!

Work terms: Summer or Fall 2023 

Job Location: 

Montréal (2020 boul. Robert-Bourassa) 

St-Hyacinthe (2450 Girouard Ouest) 

Québec (5700 boul. des Galeries) 

What you’ll do here: 

• Support the company\'s strategy by tracking the profitability and competitiveness of our insurance portfolios and helping to prepare an action plan for the coming years. 

• Use actuarial techniques to ensure that the Company has adequate loss reserves and reinsurance as well as a sufficient amount of capital to respond to various catastrophe scenarios. 

• Contribute to the company\'s innovation initiatives in machine learning, customer experience, usage-based insurance and climate change. 

• Support other departments like Underwriting, Marketing, Risk Management and Finance. 

Qualifications 

What you bring to the table: 

• Have an excellent ability to adapt to change 

• Can work in teams 

• Can work independently and have a sense of responsibility 

• Have a strong oral and written communication skills  

• Have the ability to analyze and synthesize 

These are the requirements to apply:  

• Studying toward an undergraduate degree in Actuarial Sciences 

• Interest in computer science, technology and innovation (an asset) 

• Bilingualism (French and English) is required 

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

• Visualize a career in insurance as you discover more about our exciting, evolving industry 

• Build relationships and networks to support your professional growth and success 

• Expand your skills through collaboration with and training from our experts 

• Collaborate with colleagues on developmental projects and share your knowledge

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.

your resume and your last University transcript.

item.title: Lead QA Engineer Developer, AI projects, Hong Kong AI
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Our Intact Lab in Hong Kong is looking for an experienced Lead QA Engineer to join the AI Engineering team.

Intact Lab, Hong Kong location: Building 19W, 19 Science Park West Avenue, Hong Kong Science Park

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab is located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park to turn this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

About the role

As a tech pioneer in a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Contribute to high performing and scalable data analytics pipeline for real-life customer and business issues

  • Influence the AI roadmap for the largest home, auto business insurer in Canada

  • Explore and master new technologies to use them in your own solutions

  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design

  • Mentor and coach interns and other developers to help us grow, as a team

All this plus great work-life balance, ergonomic office set-up, and our coffee & snack corner!

Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, AI or a related discipline

  • 4/5+ years of experience in test automation (backend)

  • Proficiency in Python is a must

  • Experience with Flask, PyTest is preferred

  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo

  • Ability to transform vaguely defined issues into a testing environment

  • A good communicator (oral and written) in English

  • Great teamwork and ability to coach others

Some nice-to-have

  • Software testing in the context of AI application

  • Experience with MongoDB, Kafka, AWS

  • Knowledge of DevOps modern tools

Life in the Lab

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

Together, you will tackle challenging problems and have the freedom to imagine, research, create, test, and bring innovative solutions to life that will have a profound impact on our business and the needs of our customers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s leading a new, exciting project or moving into a different A.I. product team in Canada or Hong Kong, your career will always be on the move.

About Us

The Intact Lab – with headquarters in Montreal, Canada – is a fast-growing, digital innovation hub backed by Intact Financial Corporation (TSX: IFC, HK$110 billion in market cap), Canada’s largest home, auto and business insurance company. 

Intact Financial (HK) limited (Intact Lab, HK) is our first R&D A.I. centre outside of Canada. This expansion into the Asia Pacific region is an exciting chapter of our journey to become the best insurance A.I. shop in the world.

#LI-IT #LI-Hybrid

item.title: Chercheur UX - 4 mois Stage/Coop (Été 2023)
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

C\'est plus qu\'une belle carrière. C\'est un bel avenir. 

 

Êtes-vous un étudiant ou un nouveau diplômé qui souhaite acquérir une expérience inestimable dans l\'industrie et accélérer une carrière passionnante ? Chaque année, nous accueillons plus de 300 stagiaires à travers le pays ! Nos stages et stages coopératifs offrent une expérience de travail significative ainsi qu\'une formation et un encadrement précieux en cours d\'emploi. Non seulement vous acquerrez une solide expérience, mais vous contribuerez également à la vision de l\'équipe et rencontrerez des gens formidables en cours de route. 

 

Nous recherchons de futurs talents qui aimeraient grandir avec nous. Si vous pensez que le stage de Chercheur UX est fait pour vous et que vous souhaitez faire partie de la famille Intact, veuillez lire ce qui suit et envoyez-nous votre candidature dès aujourd\'hui ! Attention, il s\'agit d\'un stage rémunéré ! 

 

Ce que vous pourriez faire ici : 

L\'équipe de recherche UX d\'Intact Lab se concentre sur la création des meilleures expériences possibles pour les personnes qui utilisent nos produits en ligne, par ex. notre application, sites Web. En étroite collaboration avec votre responsable au sein de l\'équipe UX de recherche, nous définirons en collaboration des projets adaptés à vos compétences qui contribuent également à la recherche et à la stratégie de produits. Selon vos compétences, vous pourrez : 

 

  • Soutenir le responsable de la recherche dans sa planification de bout en bout, par ex. un soutien administratif ou une aide à la rédaction de documents clés tels que des guides de discussion ou des filtres 

  • Aider à documenter et à synthétiser les résultats des études de recherche, par ex. par la prise de notes, l\'utilisation de logiciels de recherche, l\'analyse de données brutes 

  • Aider à recruter des participants à la recherche 

  • Réaliser des benchmarks de produits en ligne 

 

Qualifications 

  • Compétences en recherche UX ou recherche en design, design produit et/ou design service 

  • Enthousiasme pour l\'apprentissage de la recherche qualitative pour les produits en ligne 

  • Le bilinguisme (français et anglais) est considéré comme un atout majeur car ce rôle nécessite d’interagir sur une base régulière avec des collègues partout au pays 

  • Tu seras disponible 35 heures par semaine du 8 mai au 25 août 2023 

  • Si vous n\'êtes pas sûr de correspondre à cette description, mais que vous êtes enthousiasmé par ce que vous pourriez faire pour aider Intact Lab à produire des recherches UX de pointe pour le produit, vous êtes fortement encouragé à postuler ! 

 

Votre carrière commence ici. Postulez dès aujourd’hui! 

Nous avons hâte d’apprendre à te connaître. N’oublie pas de joindre ton CV et ton relevé de notes universitaires ou collégiales à ton formulaire de candidature. Nous embauchons des stagiaires chaque session (hiver, été et automne)! 

#LI-IT #LI-Hybrid IN-QC

item.title: iOS Developer (Senior/Specialist/Tech Lead)
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? We bet that if you discover the Intact Lab, you\'ll be in for quite the surprise! At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

Are you passionate about iOS development? Would you love to join a dynamic team which strives to build a world-class, 5-star app? Are you an advocate for seamless code and design?

As an iOS Developer, you play a critical role in developing and improving our mobile ecosystem. You will join a one of our multi-disciplinary squads. Our squads focus on the following missions: Our overall app experience and value-added features, our Telematics program, and finally, features related to Home and Auto Claims.

What you’ll do here 

  • Conceive and build native apps for iOS

  • Define and oversee application architecture

  • Ensure performance, quality and security

  • Integrate polished user experiences with modern design patterns

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of experts in product, design and development

  • Ensure the iOS development practice is evolving in the right direction

What we look for : 
If you are an experienced iOS Developer, we are interested to meet and learn what you could bring to our team! We are looking for team players who are self-driven, curious and ingenious, able to share and receive feedback and who care about quality. 

What you bring to the table

  • Experience in mobile software development

  • Multiple published mobile applications

  • Expertise in the Swift and Objective-C languages

  • Familiarity with implementing features leveraging native hardware

  • Experience with object-oriented software development, RESTful APIs and push notifications

  • Experience with agile Scrum development methodologies

  • Experience with Git and Atlassian tools

  • Love for polished, beautiful applications

  • Good communication and collaboration skills

  • Need to interact on a regular basis with colleagues across the country

Interview process

We strive to make our recruitment process efficient and lightweight. 

  • 30 min call with our HR Talent acquisition expert.

  • 1h Behavioral and technical interview with the managers, mobility and a developer from your future team

item.title: Research Intern, PhD, Summer 2023
item.description:
2022-12-07T11:04:26.957Z

Research Intern, PhD, Summer 2023

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
  • + 2 more locations
Apply

Please complete your application before March 31st, 2023 . Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the internship program.

This internship is intended for students who are currently pursuing a PhD degree program in Computer Science or a related field with an anticipated graduation date on or after December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating after December 2024, we encourage you to apply to the Student Researcher opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a PhD degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Developing).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada and available to work full time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term time.
  • Anticipated graduation by December 2023 or returning to a degree program after completion of the internship.
  • Experience contributing research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, JavaScript, C/C++, etc.).
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About the job

Join us for a full-time, 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. Research happens across Google everyday, in many different teams. Our research has already impacted user-facing services across Google, including Search, Maps, and Google Now, and is central to the success of Google Cloud and our planet-scale computing, storage, and networking infrastructure.

Research Interns work closely with Developers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine perception, data mining, machine learning, natural language understanding, privacy, computer architecture, networking, operating systems, storage and data management, etc.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a research agenda.
  • Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

item.title: Operations Technician, Data Center (English)
item.description:
2022-12-23T14:00:52.747Z

Operations Technician, Data Center (English)

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Diploma of College Studies in Computer Science or Electronics, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in Operating Systems and Networking Protocols.
  • Security clearance from the Government of Canada for Protected B work sites.
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with computer hardware and server hardware or troubleshooting/diagnosing.
  • Experience in collaborating and partnering with teams.
  • Ability to speak in both French and English fluently.

About the job

Google isn\'t just a software company. The Hardware Operations team is responsible for monitoring the state-of-the-art physical infrastructure behind Google\'s powerful search technology. As an Operations Technician, you\'ll install, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain hardware (like servers and its components) and server software (like Google\'s Linux cluster). You\'ll also take on the configuration of more complex components such as networks, routers, hubs, bridges, switches and networking protocols. You\'ll participate in or lead small project teams on larger installations and develop project contingency plans. A typical day involves manual movement and installation of racks, and while it can sometimes be physically demanding, you are excited to work with infrastructure that is at the cutting-edge of computer technology.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google\'s product portfolio possible. We\'re proud to be our software developers, developers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Responsibilities

  • Contribute to and lead efforts/projects in the deployment, maintenance and support of data center infrastructure.
  • Lead troubleshooting and resolve escalated technical issues over a population of affected equipment.
  • Help test and troubleshoot new complex server hardware components and designs.
  • Configure and troubleshoot OS-related issues on servers.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales
item.description:
2022-12-07T11:27:39.821Z

Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 8 years of experience in media analytics, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting, or financial analysis

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience using search engine marketing (Google Ads), website analytics platforms (Google Analytics and other measurement suite products), and brand analysis techniques (upper funnel analysis)
  • Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or with other programming or scripting languages (e.g., R, Python, C++, etc.)
  • Experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling, and statistical analysis
  • Understanding and experience with spreadsheet software and presentation applications
  • Ability to analyze large datasets and translate them to actionable insights

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As an Analytical Lead, you will be a strategic analyst, advisor, and consultant, providing data supported insights to clients and agencies to help improve their business. You will also influence teammates and clients in how they think about measuring the value that they get from their marketing efforts.


Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytics stakeholders. Influence investment and measurement decisions based on impact to clients\' businesses and craft recommendations that lead to client action.
  • Lead the development and execution of client-specific measurement plans that define a roadmap to improving measurement maturity.
  • Quantify the impact of Google media on client business objectives using measurement methodologies like attribution, experiments, and marketing mix models.
  • Design and perform analyses that uncover growth opportunities for client business objectives and drive adoption of measurement and attribution solutions to better value Google and non-Google media.
  • Build ways to solve common client business needs and share best practices (e.g., analysis, tools, frameworks) and client successes across industries.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. item.title: Software Developer Intern, PhD, Summer 2023
item.description:
2022-12-07T11:20:16.817Z

Software Developer Intern, PhD, Summer 2023

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Please complete your application before February 24th, 2023.

Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the internship program.

This internship is intended for students who are currently pursuing a PhD degree program in Computer Science or a related field with an anticipated graduation date on or after December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English. Click on the “Apply” button on this page and provide the required materials in the appropriate sections (PDFs preferred):

  • 1. In the “Resume Section:” attach an updated CV or resume.
  • 2. In the “Education Section:” attach a current or recent unofficial or official transcript in English.
    • Under “Degree Status,” select “Now attending” to upload a transcript.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Pursuing a PhD degree program in Computer Science, or related technical field.
  • Experience programming in one or more of the following: C/C++, Java, or Python.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada and available to work full time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term time.
  • Returning to a degree program after completion of the internship.
  • Experience in computer science, with knowledge in data structures, algorithms, and software design.
  • Programming experience in one or more of the following: C/C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Python Objective C, Go, or similar.
  • Research experience in Algorithms, Architecture, Artificial Intelligence, Compilers, Database, Data Mining, Distributed Systems, Machine Learning, Networking, or Systems.

About the job

Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. The Software Engineering Internship program will give you an opportunity to work on complex computer science solutions, develop scalable, distributed software systems, and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal.

We offer a range of internships in either Software Engineering or Site-Reliability Engineering across North America, including the US and Canada. Our recruitment team will determine where you fit best based on your resume.

Software Developer Intern:
As a key member of a versatile team, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs. We need our engineers to be versatile, and enthusiastic in addressing problems as we continue to push technology forward. You will design, test, deploy, and maintain software solutions as you grow and evolve during your internship.

Site Reliability Intern:
Our engineers create, fix, extend, and scale the code to keep it working and to harden it against all the bad actors of the internet. We drive reliability and performance on a massive scale. You will work on software development projects to keep important business generating-critical systems up and running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our services, from monitoring and alerts to building automation infrastructure.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to address some of technology\'s greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Responsibilities

  • Create and support a productive and innovative team including working with peers, managers, and teams.
  • Develop scripts to automate routine tasks.
  • Analyze information and evaluate results to choose the best solution to effectively solve challenges.
  • Apply knowledge gained in computer science courses to real world challenges.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

item.title: Technical Operations Integrated Circuit
item.description:
2022-12-21T12:31:29.131Z

Technical Operations Integrated Circuit

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Diploma of College Studies in Computer Science or Electronics, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with Operating Systems and Networking Protocols.
  • Security clearance from the Government of Canada for Protected B work sites.
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with computer hardware and server hardware or troubleshooting/diagnosing.
  • Ability to speak and write in French fluently.

About the job

Google isn\'t just a software company. The Hardware Operations team is responsible for monitoring the state-of-the-art physical infrastructure behind Google\'s powerful search technology. As an Operations Technician, you\'ll install, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain hardware (like servers and its components) and server software (like Google\'s Linux cluster). You\'ll also take on the configuration of more complex components such as networks, routers, hubs, bridges, switches and networking protocols. You\'ll participate in or lead small project teams on larger installations and develop project contingency plans. A typical day involves manual movement and installation of racks, and while it can sometimes be physically demanding, you are excited to work with infrastructure that is at the cutting-edge of computer technology.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google\'s product portfolio possible. We\'re proud to be our software developers, developers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Responsibilities

  • Contribute to and lead efforts/projects in the deployment, maintenance and support of current and new data center infrastructure.
  • Lead complex troubleshooting and resolve critical or escalated technical issues over a population of affected equipment.
  • Help test and troubleshoot new complex server hardware components and designs.
  • Configure and troubleshoot OS-related issues on servers.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: Technical Sales Specialist, Infrastructure Modernization, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-12-15T22:30:57.429Z

Technical Sales Specialist, Infrastructure Modernization, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience in performing technical presentations or public speaking.
  • Experience with workload migrations, analyzing factors such as scalability, disaster recovery, and high availability.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • Experience with legacy and modern application development, cloud service delivery, and deployment.
  • Experience with application development technologies, architecting, and developing software or infrastructure for scalable and secure distributed systems.
  • Experience with Relational Databases, NoSQL Databases, Big Data technologies, and containers.
  • Understanding of IaaS, PaaS, FaaS (XaaS).

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Technical Specialist, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective, existing customers, and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage technical relationships with Google’s customers, including managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations, guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environments, provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization, and identify applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models.
  • Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, or Natural Sciences.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.
  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
  • Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
  • Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, etc.).
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About the job

The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on cutting-edge research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for opportunities beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don\'t always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world\'s fast-paced business needs.

item.title: Technical Solutions Developer, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-01-11T20:30:56.349Z

Technical Solutions Developer, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience reading or debugging code in one or more of the following: Java, C, C++, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript.
  • 5 years of experience with databases, data warehousing, information retrieval, or SQL.
  • Experience troubleshooting and advocating for customer needs.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with distributed, columnar, analytic oriented databases, or distributed data processing frameworks.
  • Experience with machine learning technologies, including developing, training models, or implementing solutions.
  • Experience with open source distributed storage and processing utilities in Apache Hadoop or workflow orchestration products (e.g., Apache Airflow).
  • Experience in data analytics, warehousing, Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) development, data science, or other Big Data applications.
  • Understanding of basic web technologies, Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), Integration Platform (IP) concepts, Unix, or Linux basic administration and commands.
  • Excellent attention to detail, troubleshooting, and communication skills.

About the job

The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You listen to the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Cloud business and helping companies around the world innovate.

Technical Solutions Developers own customer issues and provide support to other support teams. You will be a part of a Global team that provides support to help customers seamlessly switch to Google Cloud. You will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and when needed coding or scripting.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Manage the customers problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on Google Cloud Platform products.
  • Develop an understanding of Google product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis.
  • Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in developing, sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.
  • Work as part of a team of Developers or Consultants that globally ensure 24-hour customer support.
  • Understand customer issues and advocate for their needs with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, developing) to find ways to improve the product and lead high-quality production.

item.description:
2023-01-11T20:30:56.349Z

Technical Solutions Developer, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience reading or debugging code in one or more of the following: Java, C, C++, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript.
  • 5 years of experience with databases, data warehousing, information retrieval, or SQL.
  • Experience troubleshooting and advocating for customer needs.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with distributed, columnar, analytic oriented databases, or distributed data processing frameworks.
  • Experience with machine learning technologies, including developing, training models, or implementing solutions.
  • Experience with open source distributed storage and processing utilities in Apache Hadoop or workflow orchestration products (e.g., Apache Airflow).
  • Experience in data analytics, warehousing, Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) development, data science, or other Big Data applications.
  • Understanding of basic web technologies, Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), Integration Platform (IP) concepts, Unix, or Linux basic administration and commands.
  • Excellent attention to detail, troubleshooting, and communication skills.

About the job

The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You listen to the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Cloud business and helping companies around the world innovate.

Technical Solutions Developers own customer issues and provide support to other support teams. You will be a part of a Global team that provides support to help customers seamlessly switch to Google Cloud. You will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and when needed coding or scripting.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Manage the customers problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on Google Cloud Platform products.
  • Develop an understanding of Google product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis.
  • Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in developing, sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.
  • Work as part of a team of Developers or Consultants that globally ensure 24-hour customer support.
  • Understand customer issues and advocate for their needs with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, developing) to find ways to improve the product and lead high-quality production.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. item.title: Senior Software Developer, Chrome iOS, Security
item.description:
2022-12-07T11:39:20.857Z

Senior Software Developer, Chrome iOS, Security

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
  • 3 years of experience testing, maintaining and/or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
  • Experience in security-focused software engineering.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • 3 years of experience building software for data privacy or security (e.g., identity and access management).
  • 1 year of experience in a technical leadership role.
  • Expereince in programming language safety and semantics, operating system security, and/or platform security.
  • Experience developing for the open web platform and knowledge of x86_64 and/or arm64 assembly languages.
  • Familiarity with macOS or iOS operating system internals (XNU, launchd, Mach IPC/XPC).

About the job

Google\'s software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We\'re looking for software developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our software developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

The Chrome Security team aims to create the safest browser for a trusted web, through well-reasoned defenses, smart investments, and visible leadership. As part of that mission, we ensure Chrome makes the best possible use of the security feature of every platform it runs on.

Our work often involves large-scale engineering projects and significant collaboration between teams within Chrome, Google, and even cross companies. The work we do typically affects many stakeholders with a variety of sometimes conflicting interests, so we strive to provide the greatest possible safety for the people who depend on Chrome and Chromium.

Chrome OS delivers quality computing at scale to provide universal and unfettered access to information, entertainment, and tools. Our mission is to empower anyone to create and access information freely through fast, secure, simple, and intelligent computing.

Responsibilities

  • Identify areas for improving the security of Chrome on Mac OS and iOS.
  • Stay informed on changes to underlying operating systems to take advantage of software security mitigation.
  • Work with Chrome feature teams to develop sandboxes for their components.
  • Perform security reviews for Chrome features.
  • Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

Open Career Opportunities, Verily Life Sciences

  • Verily Life Sciences
  • In-office:
    South San Francisco, CA, USA
  • + 6 more locations

Apply to this job on the Verily Life Sciences career site at Verily Careers.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: South San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Waterloo, ON, Canada; Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel; Haifa, Israel; Boston, MA, USA; Dallas, TX, USA.

About the job

Verily, an Alphabet company, lives at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. Our mission is to make the world’s health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier lives. We are developing tools and devices to collect, organize and activate health data, and creating interventions to prevent and manage disease.

We are uniting different disciplines across life sciences and data technology because we believe it will take an expert cross-functional team to develop the next generation of health solutions. Our diverse team pushes one another as well as our collaborators to think beyond today’s assumptions and operate from a shared vision of what healthcare should be. It’s amazing what’s possible when we put our heads together.
