item.title: Staff Software Developer, Site Reliability Engineering, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-12-08T12:31:16.099Z

Staff Software Developer, Site Reliability Engineering, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages.
  • 8 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
  • 3 years of experience leading projects and designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting distributed systems.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or Engineering.

About the job

Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE ensures that Google Cloud\'s services—both our internally critical and our externally-visible systems—have reliability, uptime appropriate to customer\'s needs and a fast rate of improvement. Additionally SRE’s will keep an ever-watchful eye on our systems capacity and performance.

Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation. On the SRE team, you’ll have the opportunity to manage the complex challenges of scale which are unique to Google Cloud, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design. SRE\'s culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, problem solving and openness is key to its success. Our organization brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We encourage them to collaborate, think big and take risks in a blame-free environment. We promote self-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google\'s product portfolio possible. We\'re proud to be our engineers\' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Responsibilities

  • Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from inception and design, through to deployment, operation and refinement.
  • Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning and launch reviews.
  • Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health.
  • Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
  • Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

item.title: Developer Manager, Media, Graphics, and Display, Augmented Reality
item.description:
2022-12-07T11:10:56.825Z

Developer Manager, Media, Graphics, and Display, Augmented Reality

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).
  • 5 years of experience in a technical leadership role; overseeing projects, with 5 years of experience in a people management, supervision/team leadership role.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • 7 years of experience designing and implementing OS and application runtime components.
  • 5 years of experience in a technical leadership role leading project teams and setting technical direction.
  • 3 years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization involving cross-functional, projects.
  • Experience with bare-metal or RTOS-based microcontroller development in C or C++.
  • Experience with one or more of the following: microcontrollers, SoC, ISP, DSP, GPU, display and device drivers, hardware bring-up, power management, ARM processors, firmware, hardware/software integration, developing and debugging machine language, or wireless connectivity

About the job

Like Google\'s own ambitions, the work of a Software Developer goes way beyond just Search. Software Development Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of software developers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure software developers are able to optimize theirs. As a Software Development Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. Software Development teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software developers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.

Google\'s software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another.

You will work on and develop ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design, mobile, and more.

In this role, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as the business grows/evolves.

The Google Augmented Reality team is a diverse group of experts tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and building helpful, delightful user experiences. We\'re focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the developing efforts for the media team, including audio, video, and camera software and hardware components.
  • Guide efforts to utilize accelerators (e.g., DSPs, GPUs, hardware, software, etc.).
  • Design, guide, and vet systems designs within the scope of the broader area, and write product or system development code to solve ambiguous problems.
  • Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
  • Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback and triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.

item.description:

Developer Manager, Media, Graphics, and Display, Augmented Reality

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).
  • 5 years of experience in a technical leadership role; overseeing projects, with 5 years of experience in a people management, supervision/team leadership role.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • 7 years of experience designing and implementing OS and application runtime components.
  • 5 years of experience in a technical leadership role leading project teams and setting technical direction.
  • 3 years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization involving cross-functional, projects.
  • Experience with bare-metal or RTOS-based microcontroller development in C or C++.
  • Experience with one or more of the following: microcontrollers, SoC, ISP, DSP, GPU, display and device drivers, hardware bring-up, power management, ARM processors, firmware, hardware/software integration, developing and debugging machine language, or wireless connectivity

About the job

Like Google\'s own ambitions, the work of a Software Developer goes way beyond just Search. Software Development Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of software developers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure software developers are able to optimize theirs. As a Software Development Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. Software Development teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software developers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.

Google\'s software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another.

You will work on and develop ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design, mobile, and more.

In this role, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as the business grows/evolves.

The Google Augmented Reality team is a diverse group of experts tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and building helpful, delightful user experiences. We\'re focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the developing efforts for the media team, including audio, video, and camera software and hardware components.
  • Guide efforts to utilize accelerators (e.g., DSPs, GPUs, hardware, software, etc.).
  • Design, guide, and vet systems designs within the scope of the broader area, and write product or system development code to solve ambiguous problems.
  • Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
  • Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback and triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality. 

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

item.title: Director, Technical Optical Developer, Augmented Reality
item.description:
2022-12-07T11:40:40.797Z

Director, Technical Optical Developer, Augmented Reality

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in Optics, Physics, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience working with external component vendors and partners around optical device design, fabrication, and tests.
  • 10 years of experience managing people and technical projects within hardware system development domains.
  • Experience building and leading teams across organizational structures.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience collaborating across organizational boundaries, building relationships and delivering on joint objectives and key results.
  • Ability to understand the complex relationship between the organization and its environment, identify connections, adopt different perspectives, and quickly respond to changing circumstances in a strategic way.
  • Ability to think innovatively, problem solve systematically, collaborate cross-functionally, and work through to solutions of ambiguous problems.
  • Ability to inspire and motivate all stakeholders to work together as a cohesive and highly productive unit that drives execution impact at scale.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication, and organizational skills.

About the job

In this role, you will be responsible for managing the delivery of Optical designs for Augmented Reality (AR) products including optical design, process development, test, and metrology to build toward business goals. You will lead an Optical Development team, working as part of a cross-functional program team to deliver AR products. You will build and lead a high performing, globally distributed team delivering operational excellence at scale.

You will work collaboratively with Product Management to define optical specifications, mobilize teams to deliver optical designs for AR products, define fabrication processes, establish test and metrology systems, and partner with development and operations to deliver robust manufacturable solutions. You will drive data-driven decision-making enabling AR/VR products. You will work to inspire teams and establish trust among stakeholders and customers.

The Google Augmented Reality team is a diverse group of experts tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and building helpful, delightful user experiences. We\'re focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with advanced photonics groups on research initiatives for future product optical components and technologies.
  • Lead design and development of optical display systems for AR products: light engine assemblies, waveguides, and manufacturing capabilities. Oversee planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects and define/drive the technical needs of our development partners.
  • Lead team on risk mitigation, key metric identification, schedule and budget maintenance, and efficient execution. Improve processes and tools to maximize quality and predictability of optical designs.
  • Partner with developers, product management, and leadership to ensure optical design deliverables align with hardware/software developers and product operations priorities.
  • Develop diverse talent by mentoring and planning for succession. Prioritize retention strategies for key talent.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an entire organization? Do you love collaborating with fellow data professionals to develop innovative data solutions that lead to positive business outcomes? If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard TELUS’ Data Strategy & Enablement team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of large-scale machine learning environments.

 

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team of data wizards who are capitalizing on analytics and insights to deliver exceptional products and services for our customers. In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.

 

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities; and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. At the same time, this team remains passionate champions of reliability, security and privacy by design, and is committed to creating the utmost level of privacy and security protections for all data on our networks and systems. You’ll provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments, as well as expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data
 

What you’ll do

  • Build and maintain scalable data infrastructure that offers a best-in-class experience for internal stakeholders including consistent extraction of value from the data
  • Drive data ingestion and processing in innovative ways that inform strategic priorities and decision-making across the organization
  • Foster continuous systems transformation as we migrate infrastructure and applications to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Build expertise in the team to expose efficiency insights across data platforms in the cloud
  • Manage our cloud data analytics platform priorities to make sure data security and privacy are top considerations
  • Implement automation and monitoring tools through a test-driven approach and mindset
  • Drive the adoption of new cloud technologies to further advance TELUS’ data transformation strategy

Qualifications

What you bring   

  • An expert understanding of data warehouses/cloud architectures and ETL processes
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and query authoring (SQL), as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
  • Experience with cloud platforms: GCP, Amazon or Azure (GCP gives you an edge!)
  • Experience with Python and software engineering best practices
  • Advanced knowledge in Dataflow, Spark and Kafka, as well as other data pipeline components
  • Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow
  • Experience with Github and CICD processes
  • 3+ years of progressive and relevant work experience
  • Having a proven track record in leading data analytics platform projects
  • Ready to work in new and challenging work environments
  • Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed
  • Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
  • Being a senior strategist and mentor who is sought out when it comes to analyzing and translating technicalities into business implications
  • Working in cross-functional teams with exemplary communication and coordination skills
  • Proving your analytical skills with root cause analysis of issues
  • Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo!
  • Caring passionately about your stakeholders and providing them with the data and insights they need to deliver on their customer and business outcomes

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Post graduate education in Data Engineering, Cloud DevOps or Advanced Analytics
  • Machine learning and data science knowledge
  • Experience with Java in Cloud

item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an entire organization? Do you love collaborating with fellow data professionals to develop innovative data solutions that lead to positive business outcomes? If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard TELUS’ Data Strategy & Enablement team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of large-scale machine learning environments.

 

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team of data wizards who are capitalizing on analytics and insights to deliver exceptional products and services for our customers. In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.

 

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities; and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. At the same time, this team remains passionate champions of reliability, security and privacy by design, and is committed to creating the utmost level of privacy and security protections for all data on our networks and systems.

 

You’ll provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments, as well as expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data platforms and offer the best possible analytics experience to internal stakeholders using the data. And finally, as a trusted advisor and partner, you’ll collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies.


What you’ll do

 

  • Build and maintain scalable data infrastructure that offers a best-in-class experience for internal stakeholders including consistent extraction of value from the data
  • Drive data ingestion and processing in innovative ways that inform strategic priorities and decision-making across the organization
  • Foster continuous systems transformation as we migrate infrastructure and applications to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Build expertise in the team to expose efficiency insights across data platforms in the cloud
  • Manage our cloud data analytics platform priorities to make sure data security and privacy are top considerations
  • Implement automation and monitoring tools through a test-driven approach and mindset
  • Drive the adoption of new cloud technologies to further advance TELUS’ data transformation strategy

Qualifications

What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years’ experience of data warehouses/cloud architectures and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning
  • An expert understanding of data warehouses/cloud architectures and ETL processes
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and query authoring (SQL), as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
  • Experience with cloud platforms: GCP, Amazon or Azure (GCP gives you an edge!)
  • Experience with Python and software engineering best practices
  • Advanced knowledge in Dataflow, Spark and Kafka, as well as other data pipeline components
  • Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow
  • Experience with Github and CICD processes
  • Having a proven track record in leading data analytics platform projects
  • Ready to work in new and challenging work environments
  • Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed
  • Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
  • Being a senior strategist and mentor who is sought out when it comes to analyzing and translating technicalities into business implications
  • Working in cross-functional teams with exemplary communication and coordination skills
  • Proving your analytical skills with root cause analysis of issues
  • Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo!
  • Caring passionately about your stakeholders and providing them with the data and insights they need to deliver on their customer and business outcomes

 

Great-to-haves

  • Post graduate education in Data Engineering, Cloud DevOps or Advanced Analytics
  • Machine learning and data science knowledge

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description

 

About our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Predictive Analysis & Modelling team are focussed on customer demand and intents prediction in order to inform downstream planning processes and enable optimal service levels for our customers.

 

We are data scientists, developer analysts, and strategy managers who are leveraging the latest machine learning technologies to build and support the next generation of forecast models. The demand forecasts we create set the stage for budgeting and supply planning activities, future strategy, and performance of the business.

 

As a member of our team, you’ll will enjoy a flexible work style with the ability to work at home, in an innovative and collaborative environment. You’ll create and maintain data pipelines to support our machine learning models, develop dashboards to share insights and self-serve options, and play an integral role in the development and maturity of the data strategy within our team.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology
  • Maintain existing data pipelines that feed into our machine learning models 
  • Partner with Data Scientists to identify data requirements to bring models to production
  • Analyze and profile data, perform data wrangling and dimension reduction
  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve new batch data pipelines 
  • Empower team members by creating dashboards to enable self-serve options
  • Create opportunities for ongoing innovation by maintaining an effective interlock with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities. Seek out novel data sources and make them available for modeling purposes

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Prior experience in a data engineering, business intelligence, or similar role, or equivalent education in a computer science/engineering field
  • Relevant data pipeline design, build and deploy experience. Proficiency in SQL and data modelling using Google Cloud Platform, including Big Query and Cloud Storage
  • Previous experience designing data processing systems with validation and logging practices an asset
  • Data visualization experience using Data Studio, Looker, Domo, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar
  • Light development experience with Python, Javascript, and/or C# a plus for more complex data extraction, transformation, ingestion
  • Working knowledge of job scheduling platforms and orchestration (Apache NiFi)

item.title: Senior Data Engineering Consultant, TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team 

 

Our Team – TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics - has a mandate to build solutions for our stakeholders using data to drive business outcomes. We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, analytics, and marketing, the courage to innovate, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As a Senior Data Engineering Consultant in the team, you will be working with Business Stakeholders and the Data Scientists to build data assets that will be leveraged by the data scientists for machine learning/AI models to protect the customer base, acquire new customers and to enable intelligent marketing campaigns. Your solutions will have a direct impact on marketing sales targets and P&L.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Design and build scalable and resilient Data & Analytics solutions in Google Cloud Platform – architect technical solutions to obtain, process, store and provide insights based on processed data
  • Build data assets for machine learning purposes on Google Cloud Platform 
  • Work on automation and optimization of internal processes
  • Provide data analysis and standard reporting support 
  • Design, develop, and review data architecture, model, flow, and integration – be hands on and involved with every stage of the ETL pipeline
  • Keep up to date with the evolving Cloud technology and Big Data technology, share the knowledge across the organization by enabling best practices, standards, governed processes and relevant technologies

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Bachelors and/or Master’s degree preferred
  • 5 years of experience in big data analytics and distributed systems
  • Experience in writing code/ETL processes/Monitoring processes in a production ready environment
  • Knowledge of Big Data with a focus on data engineering; optimizing data, pipelines, ETLs
  • Experience implementing production level deployments at an enterprise scale on Google Cloud Platform
  • Strong coding and development skills in programming languages (e.g. Python, PySpark etc.)
  • A Strong understanding of data structures, databases, data lakes, and data ingestion and transformation routines

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Google Cloud Platform Experience
  • Post graduate education in Data, Advanced Analytics, Computer Science Eng/Programming or any other relevant program
  • Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, optimization, and deep learning experience or knowledge
  • Telecom industry experience 
  • B2B Experience


#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Lead Data Engineer
item.description:
Description


 

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


We are looking for an enthusiastic Lead Data Engineer who can help us bring focus, flow, and joy to all developers at TELUS as part of our Platform Engineering team.
 
We believe that a strong data science competency is required at TELUS for our business to be successful, and that happy humans build fantastic software. And so our calling is to improve developer focus, flow, and joy at TELUS. This means implementing changes to our systems and processes to make developer platform insights into reality.
 
 

What you will do
 

  • Lead a team of data engineers, data analysts and developers on our journey to strengthen the developer experience through all data ingested, secured, managed, processed and analyzed on our metrics platform
  • Lead initiatives that will improve focus, flow, and joy for software developers across the organization
     
  • Work with equally smart, grounded and collaborative individuals, as well as down-to-earth leaders who get stuff done and deliver measurable results
  • Lead challenging and interesting problems, and strive to do the right thing, the right way and continuously improve via KPIs
  • Innovate every day and have the freedom to contribute your ideas
  • Drive the development of data analytics strategy by developing and enhancing data democratization principles
  • Present our users with relevant, actionable and timely data to improve on software development KPIs such as stability, velocity and availability

 

The platform engineering team is delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data,

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, we believe that anything is possible and can be achieved by innovative and meaningful outcomes for our customers, team members and that through meaningful and impactful endeavors we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

We intend to shape the future of how machine learning, data processing and analysis can drive TELUS through insights that solve releasing software to production on-demand.

 

Help architect the future of our enterprise data solutions and leverage the best of Google Cloud’s data management, analysis and machine learning capabilities and drive forward our data strategy.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Overseeing the team that builds and iterates data pipelines to process data either where it lives, or across boundaries into a single system. 
  • Analyze datasets, build data relationships and models to generate reports, meaningful insights and machine learning automation to support the business
  • Build a cohesive data platform that extends between the cloud and our data centers which can ingest, transform and process data.
  • Support operational efficiencies across our people, software engineering processes, management and our technical programs by leveraging data retrieved from our systems and tools.
  • Lead the team supporting the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models. Explore the latest tools and API’s that can help optimize our Machine Learning operations.
  • Lead the team to assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data from both inside and outside of Telus.

Qualifications


 

What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
     
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning 
  • Realize the vision of Data Democratization for software delivery metrics. Educate our customers on how to work with data to improve and reap the rewards
  • AI/ML tools expertise
  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience
  • Experience working with Google Cloud data products (CloudSQL, Spanner, Cloud Storage, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Dataproc, Bigtable, BigQuery, DataLooker, Dataprep, Composer, etc)
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • Communication skills to ensure effective management of relationships, prepare presentations for leadership consumption.

item.title: Design Specialist II - Radio Access Network (RAN) Performance & Optimization Engineer
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a member of TELUS’ wireless performance engineering team, you\'ll be responsible for optimizing the Radio Access Network (RAN), and finding new angles/methods to improve network performance, efficiently. You\'ll join the larger Wireless Networks & Services DevOps team that provides TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience, as we ready ourselves for an exciting and new 5G network. In this team, you\'ll ensure our customers\' wireless experience continuously improves. Your "think outside of the box" and innovation mentality will help shape our key performance indicators (KPIs) which we use to govern our customers\' wireless experience.


What you’ll do 

 

  • You\'ll be responsible for the wireless network performance in Western Canada
  • You’ll be optimizing our RAN as we upgrade the infrastructure through band additions and 5G deployments
  • You’ll ensure network performance KPIs are meeting our targets, and are continuously improving
  • You’ll troubleshoot network degradations, determine root causes, and look for ways to prevent or reduce the impact to our customers
  • You’ll support network upgrades by analyzing the impacts on performance, and proposing optimizations to enrich the overall customer experience
  • You’ll aid our client support teams for escalated issues that may require network engineering to resolve
  • You’ll be exposed to the latest wireless technology innovation planned for TELUS, and be ready to support their launch from a performance management perspective

What you bring 

 

  • With 7+ years of relevant professional experience
  • Recognized for your excellent knowledge of LTE and NR radio access network performance and optimization: parameter/feature optimization, signaling analysis, mobility management, traffic balancing, and self-optimizing network (SON) features
  • Respected for your RAN equipment knowledge (at least two of Huawei/Nokia/Samsung): parameters, capabilities and limitations of the hardware and software portfolio
  • Regarded for your wireless core network knowledge (VoLTE, EPC, IMS) and 5G technology roadmap
  • Acknowledged for your proficiency with the OSS (at least two of Huawei U2000 / Nokia NetAct / Samsung USM), call trace tools (ActixOne, Netscout)
  • Skilled in data science: data manipulation, statistical analysis, machine learning and automation
  • Confident with SQL, SPLUNK, Python (or other scripting languages)
  • With a Bachelor degree in Engineering or related studies

 
Great-to-haves
 

  • Passion, initiative, and a continuous improvement and learning mindset 
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, and strong presentation skills
  • Strong collaboration, teamwork and networking skills

item.title: Cloud RAN Data Scientist (Senior Design Specialist)
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) couldifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

Introducing TELUS’ new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems. 

 

As a Data Scientist working closely with various stakeholders including TELUS’ Chief Technology Office, ORAN DevOps team, and external vendors, you play a critical role in enabling ORAN intelligent operations by developing automation policies and algorithms, workflow and data processing services.

 

What you’ll do

  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure ORAN data availability and integrity to end users
  • Responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including server Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop ORAN-Cloud orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Lead platform system issue troubleshooting and integration 
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications


What you bring

  • Working experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology and Telco OSS system
  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Expertise in NiFi setup and administration 
  • Expertise in design, development, and configuration of data processing and ETL workflow
  • Expertise in design and development using Spark, Spark Streaming, Kafka, etc.
  • Familiarity with the telecommunication industry wireless access DevOps workflows of design, plan, deployment, change management and operations. 
  • Understanding of the various phases of the Software Development Life Cycle and familiarity using Source Code and Version Control systems 
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, RESTful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform.
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernetes cloud analytics tools (such as Beats, Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

  • 5G RAN cell site deployment automation development experiences, including workflow engine, inventory databases
  • Familiarity with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi or hybrid cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor flow, Mllib, H2Oai, Kubeflow etc
  • Working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking technologies such as VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-Lag, EVPN etc.

5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plans for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users

item.title: Data Ethicist - REMOTE
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customers\' privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. As the Data Ethicist, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics & Governance, you will provide thought-leadership and work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling a framework for responsible use of data, including health data. You will guide the design and development of data research, data-driven products and services in accordance with ethical principles. 


You will be a champion for data ethics across the organization and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission. Your commitment to data ethics will support our business needs as well as our position on social capitalism as we seek opportunities to innovate with data, including health data, for social good and specifically to address some of society’s most pressing problems.


Here’s how

 

  • Provide ethical analysis and questioning for the implications of data use and technology evolution that is fair and transparent, considering the experience of a broad range of stakeholders to identify potential unintended consequences and impacts 
  • Establish the data ethics framework to ensure there is understanding, consideration and foresight into the issues raised by previously unimaginable uses of data and the development of emerging technologies like AI
  • Enhance understanding of data ethics and its importance across TELUS, providing education and influencing the data user community and network of Data Stewards on responsible innovation
  • Work with TELUS engineers, researchers, designers and business stakeholders to embed ethical decision-making and risk mitigation and monitoring processes into emerging technology, ensuring that design and production is fit for purpose and beneficial
  • Maintain expert knowledge of data ethics toolkits, best practices and contribute to industry working groups on standards for data ethics and responsible innovation.
  • Define and oversee stakeholder engagement methods to incorporate participatory human-centered design and the consultation of diverse voices across the innovation lifecycle to enhance public understanding and improve the social impacts of technology
  • Learn continuously, innovate every day and seek opportunities to develop and demonstrate thought leadership with external stakeholders

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • University degree or equivalent experience in applied ethics, philosophy, ethical machine learning, human-computer interaction, social and human sciences, or relevant fields
  • Valued for your knowledge and expertise in data ethics and ethical risk assessments of emerging technology
  • Experienced in establishing ethical decision-making and monitoring processes
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in conducting analysis around societal expectations, including identifying stakeholder values and defining techniques for engagement and input
  • Highly adaptable and comfortable working in a nascent field in a demanding and fast-paced environment
  • Able to identify and proactively consider opportunities outside of conventional thinking, providing multiple solutions to resolve problems and address gaps
  • Effective in written communication and verbally communicating progress on initiatives in leadership forums
  • Trusted as a collaborative partner with excellent interpersonal skills who will act with integrity and exemplify ethical practices to fulfill TELUS’ commitments to its customers
  • Post-secondary degree is a requirement


Great-to-haves

 

  • Bilingualism in English & French, verbal and/or written
  • Experience working in a large, matrixed organization
  • Experienced in implementing multidisciplinary data ethics practices and collaborating in a cross-functional environment working with technology, policy, engineering, product and research teams

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution.
Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.


What you’ll do

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Design and implement solutions that move us forward on our MLOPs, DevOps and infrastructure as code journey within GCP
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Implement best in class cloud architecture to solve business use cases from concept to production
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You have in depth knowledge of data architecture both on premise and on GCP, AWS and / or Azure platforms and have demonstrated experience designing and implementing enterprise grade data environments
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform, Kubernetes, Composer and serverless computing
  • You have in depth experience with the flow of data between systems, cloud big data environments and tooling with applications such as BigQuery, Dataflow, BigTable, Data Catalog, CloudSQL, Vertex AI, Pub/Sub, Dataprep and Cloud Spanner
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs to senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You have demonstrated experience with Secure by Design and Zero Trust data architectures and are able to provision cloud infrastructure with best in class security
  • You have in depth knowledge of PII and privacy compliance and have demonstrated architectural design, system interactions and life cycle management that puts customer safety first
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use casesYou have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Experience with MLOPs methodologies and process
  • Data Warehousing and data modeling design experience
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management

item.title: Senior Strategy Manager, Data Platforms
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, modern BI tools, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform and BI toolsets.

 

We are looking for enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solutions enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.  You will support digital transformation at TELUS by partnering with teams across the organization to make better use of their data. Use your strong communication, critical thinking and change management experience to assess the impact of transformation on our partner teams, the upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. 

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Support the establishment of data a shared strategy across the enterprise to enable the business to meet its strategic and financial objectives
  • Support the creation of automated work intake process, prioritization, metrics, process improvements and resource alignment to planned roadmaps
  • Drive a governed approach with increasing maturity around our data & analytics platforms and tools
  • Liaise with our business and IT partners to ensure alignment on roadmaps and strategic initiatives delivering value and supporting a data driven culture
  • Lead annual strategy reviews for the Enterprise Data Platforms team and collaborate with owners in our larger business unit including coordination and material creation

  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Support our internal web presence, knowledge portal, intake process, and “Quick Reference Guides” increasing customer awareness and standardization of data environments across TELUS
  • Author quality documentation and materials to support messaging around new data capabilities, services and analytics tools, roadmaps, customer onboarding to our data platform, roadmaps, change management and alignment across IT teams

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5-7 years of experience in a Management Consulting, Digital agency or Corporate Strategy with a large organization
  • 3-5 years of experience working in Technology
  • Experience helping organizations evolve their way of working, defining and implementing new operating models and standing up Transformation efforts
  • You are an exceptional communicator that excels at compelling storytelling and presentations
  • You have good understanding of Data & Analytics principles and tools and digital transformation initiatives
  • You have experience managing business stakeholders and engaging with many diverse technical teams to aligning deliverables
  • You have a proven track record of engaging with technical leaders and SMEs to create quality roadmaps to be reviewed and accepted at a senior level within the organization
  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You can distill complex solutions and interactions to gain support and engagement with senior leaders and business stakeholders

Great-to-haves

item.title: Manager, Data Engineering
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, Enterprise Data Engineering. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps as well as provide overarching direction to support our TELUS Business Solutions Team (TBS).

 

The portfolio will focuses on continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, real-time data ingestion, addressing technical debt and support the Business Master Data Management (MDM) and Revenue Generating Unit (RGU) workstreams. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission and purpose.

 

What you’ll do

 

 At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

 

  • Lead a team of talented data platform Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings.
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team

Qualifications


What you bring

 

You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction

  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam) and Kafka
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectivenes

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

item.title: Senior Business Analyst (Data Specialist)
item.description:
Description

 

As part of our exciting journey towards retiring our copper network, we’ve established a brand-new, transformational TELUS-wide program. This program will address network optimization with the goal to eliminate dual support cost structures between the Copper and Fibre network, fully unleashing the benefits of our generational investment in our PureFibre network. We are scaling the program and seeking team members to be part of one of the most transformational projects at TELUS.

 

Join our team:

 

  • Located within our Customer Network Implementation (CNI) team, a team that is a key driver of TELUS’ annual ~$2.9 billion in capital expenditure, our copper retirement program will be responsible for the development and execution of our one network strategy
  • We are focused on aligning key stakeholders across the organization to accelerate the journey to Fibre, optimize our Central Office (CO) footprint, enable power cost savings and ultimately shut down our copper network across communities
  • This work will also help transform the customer experience, field delivery and network quality, and reliability metrics in our new Fibre dominant footprint
  • Visit www.telus.com/copperretirement to learn more about the program

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

 As a Sr Business Analyst in Project Penny, you will be accountable for liaising with key business stakeholders, understanding the business context and tackling roadblocks. You will accomplish your objectives by identifying opportunities, driving innovation and working closely with stakeholders to support copper retirement deliverables. 

 

Here’s how

 

  • You drive work to completion and effectively manage and report on scope, risks & issues, and timelines 
  • You can demonstrate a proven capability to engage key stakeholders and work across different business units leveraging the most appropriate collaboration tools to support virtual team working
  • You migrate various data to interactive and automated dashboards 
  • You take analytics framework into the next level and lead stakeholders to adopt new frameworks and methodologies
  • You will partner with senior leaders and stakeholders to drive key strategic and transformational initiatives to ensure TELUS consistently outperforms our competition
  • You are an organized and compelling communicator with the ability to clearly articulate complex concepts and storylines through various mediums, especially Google Mail, Slides, Docs, Sheets, Forms, DOMO and other platforms

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • 3+ years of business analyst experience within technology and analytics 
  • 3+ years of experience developing intermediate to advanced SQL queries to operate database & data processing
  • 3+ years of experience performing data analysis and data quality
  • 1-3 years of experience with Python/R for data science
  • Able to see the big picture objectives of product analytics and bring that understanding to requirements definition and help drive prioritization based on existing technology constraint
  • Demonstrated experience translating business needs and/or new ideas into detailed business requirements, to be further developed into technology solutions
  • Experience gathering and analyzing business requirements; preparing architecture diagrams, and documenting solutions end to end
  • Ability to coordinate competing priorities across multiple stakeholder groups

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira 
  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and DOMO
  • Experience with GIS
  • Knowledge of programming and/or scripting languages (Java, bash, Node JS etc)
  • Experience with legacy copper networks and their products and services
  • Mulesoft and API integration experience

item.title: Electrical Design Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:              Electrical Design Co-op
Location:             Kitchener, Ontario              
Division:              OTTO Motors
Co-op term:        Spring 2023

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.
Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors
OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com

About the Job:
You’re excited about the role that robots will play in the future, and intrigued by the challenge of joining a young company in this high-growth market. You have skills and experience that you know can make a difference with the Clearpath team, whether we\'re looking for them or not. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the Electrical design and diagnostics of self-driving platforms and attachments
  • Assist in the Electrical design and diagnostics of power distribution and motor systems
  • Assist in the Electrical design and diagnostics of battery and charging systems and interfaces
  • Low speed digital/analog circuit design
  • Cable assembly design
  • Integration and testing of prototypes into fearsome robots
  • Documentation and drawing generation
  • Physical assembly and prototyping of all the cool stuff

Additional tasks may include:

  • Care, feeding, and testing of new products.
  • Evaluating and documenting emerging and current manufacturing processes
  • Supporting on-site installation and commissioning of robotics equipment at Clearpath facilities

Job Requirements:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Able to quickly grasp fundamentals of common sensors and actuators used for robotics and automation.
  • Avid self-learner.
  • Fearless in asking questions while thinking you are the only one who does not understand.
