item.title: Hardware Test Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:           Hardware Test Co-op
Location:          Cambridge, Ontario 
Term:                 Spring 2023 
Study Level:     Senior
Area of Study:  Mechanical / Systems / Mechatronics Engineering

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

According to US NSC statistics from 2019: 8,140 injuries were related to forklift operations. These numbers have continued to increase. By replacing manually driven forklifts with autonomous vehicles, accident rates can be reduced and lives can be saved. Even if the work you will be doing impacts those numbers by 0.1%, it means that 8 people will be going home safely at the end of their shift. To us, it matters.

About the Job

Want to break stuff? Want to do things nobody has done before? Join the Hardware Test Team at OTTO Motors! We experiment with state-of-the-art AMR technology to discover its strengths and weaknesses.

The Hardware Test Team is responsible for devising and enacting test plans that provide real actionable data that directly influences product design, configuration, and standards compliance. The team is responsible for executing system and subsystem level design validation and product reliability tests to further improve the industrial strength of our product line. You will be an integral part of a team focused on providing real data that makes a significant impact on the way design choices are made at OTTO Motors.

We will need you to always be ready to think outside the box, troubleshoot problems, and desire to apply your technical skills to break down challenges & problems, and work on them one at a time. We will need you to focus on the purpose of the tests in hand, while having the bigger picture in mind how your contributions will result in a positive impact for our engineering design and safety of our products.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Assisting in the developing and tuning of Vehicle Dynamics simulation models using multibody modeling software
  • Developing and executing validation tests for system functionality and performance targets
  • Generating test reports that concisely and accurately describe testing conditions, methods, and results
  • Continuously studying industrial AMRs; how they work, how they fail and FMEA
  • Participating in test plan reviews and contribute to the team’s testing strategy
  • Commissioning, integration & support of mock workflows at our test facility to enable testing of different sample use cases as well as project specific workflows
  • Developing and executing stress tests of subsystems to improve hardware reliability
  • Troubleshoot, repair, and report industrial robot failure
  • Comprehend and apply standards that pertain to AMR performance and testing
  • Gather and analyze data with excel, ubuntu terminal commands, bash and python scripts
  • Solving new and challenging technical problems related to all of the above

Additional responsibilities include:

  • Consulting other departments on vehicle dynamics, reliability, and how to design fruitful tests
  • Troubleshooting software & hardware issues using various internal and external tools 
  • Developing & maintaining reference documentation & tools that help improve the Hardware Test Team’s ability to test industrial robots
  • Optimizing vehicle performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation
  • Communicating technical details to the broader team;
  • Recommending new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • Work with Solidworks CAD software to design test fixtures and calculate mass properties of various test setups

Required skills & Experience:

  • Highly detail oriented individual
  • Not being afraid to challenge assumptions or the status quo
  • Strong communicator, verbal and written
  • Self-motivated and well organized
  • Interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • Planning & organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • Ability to stay focused on the overall goal; effectively analyzing the value of going down rabbit trails

Bonus Points For:

  • Prior experience in vehicle dynamics analysis and/or testing
  • Experience with Multibody modeling packages like MAPLESIM, Simspace and ADAMS
  • Experience with 3D CAD/Solidworks
  • Interest in learning and/or prior experience with component vibration and HALT/HASS testing
  • Exposure to working with Linux based OS (Operating System)
  • Authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Junior - UX Research Analytics Implementation - Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position: Junior - UX Research Analytics Implementation - Co-op
Location: Kitchener, Ontario (hybrid-remote)              
Experience: 0-3
Education: Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or higher in UX/UI Design, Computer Science, Information Science, Data Science, Statistics, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, or other related field.
Division: OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Opportunity 

We are looking to fill a UX Research Analytics Implementation role on our UX Team. In this role, you will help us answer foundational questions about our users, dive into our analytics and prepare insightful stories that will help shape the decisions we make.

This role will have an emphasis on analytics but you will also gain experience though user interviews,  usability testing, surveys, and A/B testing.

In this role, you will gain experience setting up analytics tools for our digital products in order to collect user interaction data from multiple sources. Some of the tools you will use include Kibana, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Full Story.

As part of the UX Team, you will work closely with the Product and Engineering teams to ensure project success.

As a UX Research Analytics Implementation Co-op, You Will 

  • Participate in building our analytics dashboards, and identify patterns in user behaviours based on quantitative data.
  • Code tooling to help analyze customer data to enable better UX decisions.
  • Support the creation of internal processes and documentation governing aspects of analytics tagging, and implementation.
  • Ensure that data flows smoothly from our web apps into our analytics reporting suite.
  • Work collaboratively with the UX team to run studies of designs and features. 
  • Share evidence-based recommendations in a clear and engaging manner to diverse stakeholders.
  • Participate in the analysis & review of research findings to brainstorm novel solutions to user needs.

Who You Are

As a UX Research Analytics Implementation Co-op, you want to work in a team that’s flexible and where everyone contributes. You don’t have an ego but instead, embrace the value of collaborative design. You know that communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills are simply part of the design process. You love tackling complex problems with an open mind, knowing there are different approaches to solving problems. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and enthusiastic about their work. 

You Come Ready With

  • A strong passion for analytics, and a desire to work on a team that is user focussed.
  • The ability to write code, javascript, python, or some other language that you can leverage to make and edit analytics tools.
  • An eye for design and an appreciation for the impact it can have on effective communication.
  • An understanding of qualitative and quantitative user research methods such as interviews, usability studies, competitive analyses, surveys, A/B testing.
  • Excellent teamwork & communication skills to effectively collaborate with a multi-functional and multi-disciplined team.
  • You are observant, empathetic, and aren’t afraid to ask the right questions at the right time. 
  • You are a self-starter. You take leadership and see projects through to completion with high attention to detail.
  • You are constantly pursuing excellence and always looking to grow and learn new things.
  • You are an equally great communicator whether you are in person or online.
  • You must be eligible to work in Canada.

What’s In It For You?

  • Flexibility in when and where you work (fully remote, hybrid or office-based), core hours are 10 am - 3 pm EST
  • Supportive colleagues and meaningful connections: We pride ourselves on our collaborative and innovative culture. We will make sure you are set up for success and we do our best to support your professional development.
  • Enjoy designing the future of robotics!

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, colour, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status, gender identity or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1 (844) 733-6886.

item.title: Mechanical Design & Testing Intern
item.description:
Description

Position:          Mechanical Design & Testing Intern           

Location:          Kitchener & Cambridge, Ontario    

Term:                Spring 2023 (May - August) 

Study Level:     Mid-Senior

Area of Study:  Mechanical/Mechatronics

Division:           OTTO Motors


About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You\'re excited about the role that robots will play in the future, and intrigued by the challenge of joining a young company in this high-growth market. You have skills and experience that you know can make a difference with the Clearpath team, whether we\'re looking for them or not. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Most of all, you want to be on the right side during the coming robot revolution.

Job Responsibilities:

You will support the design, verification/testing and upkeep of our robots\' mechanical systems. Your tasks could range from performing field testing of our newest generation of unmanned surface vehicle to designing structural components for an off-road ground vehicle. You may be required to take robots for walks, and are able to cope with the questioning stares of onlookers. You may be required to execute system and subsystem level design validation and product reliability tests to further improve the industrial strength of our product line.

Additional tasks may include:

  • Prototyping of new electromechanical systems.
  • Test plan development and implementation.
  • Modeling, drafting and specification of custom parts and assemblies.
  • Sourcing and qualification of new mechanical components and systems.
  • Pushing our robots to their breaking points.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Capable hands-on skills. You are able to turn a car into a boat if necessary.
  • Team player, good communicator, able to cope with sarcasm.
  • Able to cope with sudden jarring changes in projects, priorities, and the local gravity field.
  • Past experience with building robots or other vehicles which are larger than a breadbox.
  • SolidWorks modeling and drafting experience.
  • Experience having parts manufactured to your specifications.
  • Basic electrical prototyping & troubleshooting experience.

Helpful

  • Familiarity with Linux, C, Python, ROS.
  • Experience with common sensors and actuators used for robotics.
  • Experience with the control of mobile robots.
  • Machine shop experience.
  • Experience with sheet metal parts.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Software Developer Co-op (OS Team)
item.description:
Description

Position:          Software Developer Co-op (OS Team)       
Location:          Kitchener, Ontario     
Duration:          Spring 2023
Student Level:  Junior
Area of Study:  Software Engineering/Computer Science

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the job:

You will be joining the OS (Operating Systems) team responsible for bridging the gap between the mechanical machine, the autonomy stack and the fleet manager. In this team, you will have the opportunity to experience a very broad software stack ranging from middleware software applications to very high-level server functionality.

Your primary responsibility will be to tackle hard problems and you’ll have the opportunity to show your skills in a team of highly competent developers. To be successful, you will work closely with your mentor to sharpen your C++ and Python coding knowledge and learn everything you need to know about ROS (Robot Operating System) as well. A self-driving robot is a complicated system, and you’ll need to be able to understand enough of it to figure out how to complete your tasks. You will need to be able to make progress independently as well as leverage your team’s knowledge to be most efficient. Once you have a viable solution to a problem, you’ll test and validate it on our fleet of test robots.

OTTO is a hybrid workplace, so you’ll have to be physically present in the office at least once a week.

Additional tasks may include:

  • Troubleshoot, address and validate issues.
  • Enhance existing components with new functionality.
  • Work collaboratively with a senior developer on a larger project.

Required Skills:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines independently.
  • Practical software development skills.
  • Team player, good communicator.
  • Experience with Linux.
  • Version control (Git).
  • Proficiency in C++ and Python.

Helpful:

  • Unit testing, system-level testing, and continuous integration.
  • Bash, or other scripting experience.
  • Exposure to CMake, especially in a packaging or deployment context.
  • Experience with ROS, or other robotics middleware.
  • JIRA

item.title: Electrical Technologist
item.description:
Description

Position: Electrical Technologist  

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Experience: 3+ years of relevant experience with robot deployment

Education: Technical diploma in Electrical Engineering or Electrician certification or equivalent

Division: OTTO Motors

 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job

You will be responsible for working with members of OTTO Motors’ electrical product team as we develop new vehicles for our expanding fleet. You will work with our Electrical Engineering team to develop electrical systems, help build the robots from the ground up,  repair robots, as well as maintain test equipment, and instrumentation. You will also help us continue to increase our test coverage and assist with engineering-led testing and service at client facilities. Finally, you will work with key members of the wider company to transition our work to the broader organization, including Testing, Quality, Production, Client Success, Professional Services, and other groups.

 

Primary responsibilities include:

  • On-the-fly wiring, assembly, and modification of a small quantity of large vehicles
  • Assist Electrical Engineers during verification and test procedures
  • Development of testing and documentation for vehicles and subsystems. 
  • Repair or replace various subsystems of the robot as needed.
  • Keeping engineering’s test/build facilities organized and maintained.

 

Additional tasks:

  • Any other design or development work which needs to be done which you are capable of.
  • Assisting the project team with initial test deployments
  • Support of initial systems alongside the rest of the project team
  • Support debugging of issues from harnesses, PCBA, or PLC

 

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

 

Required skills:

  • Possess skills in reading and interpreting technical drawings, electrical schematics prints, electrical and harness drawings. 
  • Experience in building and installing electrical harnesses and cables, connector and component selection, systems wiring. 
  • Has already encountered robots breaking in unpredictable ways at the worst possible times
  • Experience with getting technical multi-discipline tasks done quickly
  • Comfortable working in small groups with minimal oversight
  • Working knowledge in relation to safety when working with electrical and electronic equipment. 

 

Bonus points for one or more of the following:

  • Experience with Vesys and/or Altium
  • Electrical panel build experience is considered an asset.
  • Good attention to detail, organization, and time management skills.
  • Familiar with CSA/UL, NFPA and IPC Standards
  • Knowledge of PLCs
  • Past experience learning from development projects that have gone wrong
  • Basic ROS experience

 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Intermediate Program Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:                Intermediate Program Manager           
Location:               Kitchener, ON                          
Job Type:              Full-Time Permanent
Experience:          3+ years’ experience       
Education:            Bachelor\'s
Division:               OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are building a robotics platform. We are growing and need to add a new program manager to manage both our internal teams and external relationships with key partners.

As a Program Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating program deliverables and serving as the point of contact between partners and other departments. Your goal is to manage the efforts of team members to ensure our programs are delivered on time and that our partners’ needs are met.

Your Primary Responsibilities will be:

  • Generate and manage the Joint Program Plan from kickoff to product release
  • Scheduling, Task Decomposition, and Resource Management
  • Analyze, evaluate, and mitigate program risks, and produce reports for management and stakeholders
  • Actively manage and expedite critical path tasks
  • Create and maintain a program schedule
  • Work with technical leads to identify:
    • Tasks and Dependencies
    • Resources Requirements (Personnel, Equipment, etc.)
  • Integrate with Software, Hardware and OEM Development Programs
  • Work with the other program managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple programs
  • Identify key requirements needed from cross-functional team, external vendors and partners
  • Track Program/Product Requirements and Specifications
  • Ensure completion of requirements implementation and verification
  • Working with external partners to ensure program success.  Establish and maintain:
    • Joint schedule
    • Joint risk management activities
    • Communication channels with all stakeholders
    • Action logs and tracking actions to completion
  • Risk Assessment and Management
    • Maintain a Risk Register
  • Managerial
    • Issue Escalation
    • Mentorship
    • Conflict Resolution
    • Relationship Management    

Required Technical Skills

  • Project Management Software
    • Gantt Charts (i.e. MS Project)
    • Task and Issue Tracking (i.e. JIRA)
    • Configuration Control
    • Requirements and Specifications tracking
  • Documentation
    • Solid writing skills
    • Good with spreadsheets to communicate complicated status
    • Executive presentations through effective slides
    • Documentation
  • 3 years of project or program management experience from previous work placements (co-ops included)
  • Conflict resolution and people interface skills
  • Experience with direct customer contact

As our next Program Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and multiple stakeholders.  You have program management experience from previous work placements. Bonus points for managing engineering related programs with external partners. 

Bonus Points For

  • Mechatronics background
  • Experience in managing partners
  • 1-2 years of engineering design experience from previous work placements
  • The ability to write macros or scripts with Office programs, JIRA or data processing.

At OTTO Motors, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. item.title: Manager, Development Operations (DevOps)
item.description:
Description

Position:          Manager, Development Operations
Location:        Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:       Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     8 to 12 years
Education:      Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant work experience
Division:         OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The DevOps Team is in need of an experienced manager to help drive and maintain the continuous integration experience.  The team is tasked with ensuring that the full lifecycle of development from source submission to release is fully automated.  The team handles all aspects of the development environment and workflow; build, automated testing platforms, deployment and a full simulation stack.  We develop testing platforms so that other teams can be empowered to write automated tests.  Your day will be split between managerial and supporting development tasks.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Identify areas of improvement within the CI processes.
  • Delegate, schedule and manage tasks within the DevOps Domain (Sprint and Long-term).
  • Lead and grow a team of highly skilled developers.
  • Collaborate with other teams to determine needs and gaps.
  • Be an ambassador for quality initiatives to ensure that all teams are producing a high-quality product.  
  • Maintain and develop DevOps toolchains and automated processes.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. 

Required skills and experience:

  • Minimum 3 Years of experience managing a technical team.
  • Minimum 5 Years experience with DevOps/Continuous Integration processes.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

item.title: Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors
item.description:
Description

Position: Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors               
Location: Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 2-5 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education: Masters or PhD Degree in a related field
Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Perception Developer to work on the Perception Team in the Vehicle Software Group to focus on the development of sensor calibration algorithms.

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, calibration, sensing, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors you will develop & maintain algorithms and processes for the complete continuous calibration of robotic systems and processing of sensor data. You will be creating solutions to the challenging problems of high accuracy intrinsic and extrinsic calibration of heterogeneous sensor configurations and actuators as well as online calibration and sensor processing and monitoring for a wide range of possible robotic platforms. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

About You

For the role of Perception Developer - Calibration we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic calibration solutions for a variety of applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic calibration and perception
  • Development of custom calibration, sensor monitoring, sensor filtering, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new sensing technology and robotic platforms
  • Work with production to develop processes for sensor calibration methods
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in industry and academia 

Skills and experience:

  • Strong theoretical and practical understanding of the challenges and solutions to the problems of robotic system calibration
  • Practical knowledge of sensing technologies including LIDAR, Cameras, IMU, and their error models
  • Familiarity with robotic platforms and their motion models such as differential, ackerman, bicycle, etc.
  • Proficient software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux environment

Bonus Points For:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Proficiency with linear algebra and non-linear optimization including libraries such as ceres solver and Eigen
  • Experience with computer vision libraries such as PCL and OpenCV.
  • Experience with manufacturing tolerances of robotic systems

 

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Program Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:                Intermediate Program Manager           
Location:               Kitchener, ON                          
Experience:          3+ years’ experience       
Education:            Bachelor\'s
Division:                OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are building a robotics platform. We are growing and need to add a new program manager to manage both our internal teams and external relationships with key partners.

As a Program Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating program deliverables and serving as the point of contact between partners and other departments. Your goal is to manage the efforts of team members to ensure our programs are delivered on time and that our partners’ needs are met.

Your Primary Responsibilities will be:

  • Generate and manage the Joint Program Plan from kickoff to product release
  • Scheduling, Task Decomposition, and Resource Management
  • Analyze, evaluate, and mitigate program risks, and produce reports for management and stakeholders
  • Actively manage and expedite critical path tasks
  • Create and maintain a program schedule
  • Work with technical leads to identify:
    • Tasks and Dependencies
    • Resources Requirements (Personnel, Equipment, etc.)
  • Integrate with Software, Hardware and OEM Development Programs
  • Work with the other program managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple programs
  • Identify key requirements needed from cross-functional team, external vendors and partners
  • Track Program/Product Requirements and Specifications
  • Ensure completion of requirements implementation and verification
  • Working with external partners to ensure program success.  Establish and maintain:
    • Joint schedule
    • Joint risk management activities
    • Communication channels with all stakeholders
    • Action logs and tracking actions to completion
  • Risk Assessment and Management
    • Maintain a Risk Register
  • Managerial
    • Issue Escalation
    • Mentorship
    • Conflict Resolution
    • Relationship Management    

Required Technical Skills

  • Project Management Software
    • Gantt Charts (i.e. MS Project)
    • Task and Issue Tracking (i.e. JIRA)
    • Configuration Control
    • Requirements and Specifications tracking
  • Documentation
    • Solid writing skills
    • Good with spreadsheets to communicate complicated status
    • Executive presentations through effective slides
    • Documentation
  • 3 years of project or program management experience from previous work placements (co-ops included)
  • Conflict resolution and people interface skills
  • Experience with direct customer contact

As our next Program Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and multiple stakeholders.  You have program management experience from previous work placements. Bonus points for managing engineering related programs with external partners. 

Bonus Points For

  • Mechatronics background
  • Experience in managing partners
  • 1-2 years of engineering design experience from previous work placements
  • The ability to write macros or scripts with Office programs, JIRA or data processing.

item.description:
Description

Position:         Senior Simulation Developer          
Location:         Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    2 - 5 years of relevant work experience
Education:      Degree in a related field
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Simulation Developer to work in the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development and support.

For this role we are seeking an individual to develop & maintain software tools and assets used in our simulation stack. You will be working closely with other members of the DevOps, Vehicle Systems, Fleet software development teams as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, in order to provide robust and easy-to-use solutions to the problems our employees & customers need to solve with their simulation environments and workflows.

About You

For the role of Simulation Developer we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic simulations in a full-stack simulation environment in a small team.  Your work will directly support a variety of internal groups in testing, developing and training.

Responsibilities:

  • Designing and developing new simulation tools and assets.
  • Maintaining and extending existing simulation automation/deployment tools and assets.
  • Improving useability and robustness of our simulation tool set.
  • Writing internal documentation for new and existing simulation tools and assets.
  • Troubleshooting simulation automation/deployment issues and bugs.
  • Supporting development operations, internal tools, and infrastructure.
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure.

 Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing, maintaining, and extending simulation plugins, both internal and upstream.
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution.

Skills and experience:

  • Minimum 2-5 years of experience in software development in an enterprise environment.
  • Object-oriented programming experience (C++).
  • Working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments and scripting (Bash, Python 3.5+).
  • Use of emplating formats and markup languages (e.g. XML, YAML, JSON).
  • Using continuous integration (Jenkins/GitLab pipelines) and source control (Git).
  • Diagnosing and narrowing down the source of issues.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Creating/maintaining virtual models & environments in a physics based simulator.

Bonus Points For:

  • Other object-oriented programming experience (e.g. C#, Java)
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Experience with Gazebo/Unity/Unreal/Isaac simulation.
  • Experience in 3D graphics software and programming.
  • Experience with containers and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Nix

If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Software Developer
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position: Software Developer 

Location: Waterloo, Ontario          

Experience: 2+ Years relevant work experience         

Education: Undergraduate degree (CS or equivalent)

About Clearpath Robotics 

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a Software Developer to leverage their C/C++, Python and Robot Operating System (ROS) skills to harness the potential of our robots and create integration success stories in a wide range of application domains. Your goal is to work with our partners and customers to develop properly engineered solutions, primarily through ROS drivers and cool robot integration code, to unleash the incredible potential of the Clearpath robots. Anyone can write code that solves a single problem, but this job requires someone to develop solutions that are applicable to a wide range of applications and problem domains.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Designing and implementing software for both Clearpath robots and custom robotics applications, primarily through C/C++, Python, ROS and ROS2
  • Developing software to integrate large robot arms onto Clearpath mobile platforms
  • Creating compelling solutions for demonstrations and trade shows
  • Working with potential partners to develop joint solutions, both sensor integrations and SaaS solutions
  • Supporting our Applications Engineering team in assessing and scoping new opportunities
  • Troubleshooting robot issues: on-site, phone, email or internet support

About You

You want to work for a fast-paced growing company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are motivated, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Not only do you write reliable software, but you like the thought of working on projects that interact with the world. You enjoy working with partners and giving back to the open-source community. You\'re looking for a job where you get to interact with a diverse team and learn something new every day.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • 2+ years C/C++ and Python, preferably with exposure to ROS development
  • Experience working in a multidisciplinary team
  • Previous exposure to hardware systems or electromechanical products
  • Working knowledge of the Git version control system
  • Proficiency with Debian Linux based distributions 

Bonus points for:

  • Embedded systems development
  • General mechatronics interest and experience
  • Experience with manipulators and related driver development
  • GUI design and development (especially with React)
  • Experience leading training sessions outside the company
  • Experience with 3D mapping
  • System benchmarking, performance analysis and code complexity reduction
  • Experience with rigorous software testing and continuous integration processes
  • Contributions to open source projects

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Electrical Development Team Lead
item.description:
Description

Position:           Electrical Development Team Lead
Location:          Kitchener, ON
Job Type:          Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     5+ years relevant work experience
Education:       Degree in a related field or equivalent work experience
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will guide and manage the Electrical Development Engineering team by providing tactical day-to-day guidance and direction; establishing team strategy (objectives, metrics, priorities, and best practices); enabling the team to perform at their best, as well as applying your technical expertise to solve complex problems.  In addition, you will be responsible for significant portions of the electrical system design and implementation for our new and existing products.

The Electrical Development team works closely with our hardware, software, and new product development teams to establish sustainable development and support of our products, providing a robust design to our customers.

In addition, the team will adhere to safety standards and processes such as ISO13849, ISO12100, IEC61508, R15.08, and IEC 3691-4 or similar standards applicable to mobile robots.

Furthermore, the team is a contributor to defining our product requirements and is an influencer of our product roadmap.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Delegate, schedule, and manage tasks within the Electrical Development Team’s domain
  • Providing performance and development feedback
  • Ensuring consistent quality of service and deliverables from the Electrical Development group
  • Working with and improving our existing processes for Electrical design and development on our products
  • Adapting and improving the overall service and performance
  • Develop working relationships with vendors to help ensure OTTO motors is selecting the highest quality and latest technology parts in our products
  • Lead some technical projects yourself
  • Industrial control system design and architecture with an eye to ISO 13849, ANSI B56.5, IEC 61508 and others as needed.
  • Support high-level vehicle architecture design
  • First level of triage for electrical issues
  • Verifying basic robot functionality (ROS skills as needed)
  • Prototype assembly (Build parts of the robot as needed) 
  • Design Documentation (Meeting minutes, requirements definition, architecture documents, controls analysis, CAD, PLM, internal troubleshooting, assembly and installation documentation)
  • Write and execute good validation and test  plans for new vehicle technologies that make clear and actionable conclusions
  • Be knowledgeable in the robot product lifecycle, and bring-in feedback from all relevant parties at the right time.

Required skills:

  • Degree in engineering, computer science, robotics, or a related field with applicable background
  • 1-2+ years’ experience in a management role in an engineering environment 
  • 5+ years of experience in electrical engineering roles
  • Effective decision making
  • Strong communicator
  • Project and resource management experience
  • Technical acuity (e.g., ideas contributor to implementation strategies, product features and requirements)
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Experience with hands-on prototyping and troubleshooting of electromechanical systems
  • Able to understand and communicate concepts readily via sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Able to work in Canada

Bonus Points for:

  • Experience working with industrial robots.
  • Experience in designing to comply with the European, US and Canadian standards, particularly FCC and CE or liaising with NRTLs
  • Experience with design for functional safety (ISO 12100, EN 61508, etc.)
  • Knowledge of WHMA/IPC-A-620
  • Experience with C Language software solutions on embedded platforms e.g. C++ and Python
  • Experience with the V-model or other similar verification and validation methodologies 
  • Working knowledge of aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, controls, and navigation
  • Power distribution and motor systems
  • Low speed digital/analog circuit design
  • Cable assembly design
  • PCBA design, microprocessor and network integration (CAN, Ethernet, ModBUS etc.)
  • Familiarity with industrial material handling vehicles
  • Experience with ROS
  • Past hands-on experience with mobile robots, industrial trucks, or AGCs as an operator or developer

We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

What’s in it for you:
